Row.Text: WOLF CIV PEDIA FACTOID TITLE PLACEHOLDER

The Wolves of Yoitsu were great beings which called the snowy forest of Yoitsu their home. Many were revered as Gods to various villages and towns, and most took great pride in their responsibility to protecting the humans in their presence. While the Wisewolf, Holo, embarked on a journey across distant lands seeking companionship, Yoitsu had met with calamity. The destructive being known as the Moon-Hunting Bear descended on the village of Yoitsu, and as the legends tell of it, Yoitsu was destroyed without so much as a fight. It is yet unclear what the fate of the Wolves, who once called Yoitsu their home, has become.

O prideful Holo, great Wisewolf of Yoitsu, though your journeys have finally afforded you some measure of peace and happiness with the one you love, the people of the world once again seek your guidance. Frought with mistakes, history has become a cruel mistress. The world is in turmoil, with conflict spread far across the land. Thieves and mercenary bands now roam the land plundering and pillaging wherever they go. Attacking hapless merchants and civilians alike, they are little more than barbarians. Have the very Gods whom the humans so diligently prayed to forsaken them in the end?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Holo, the people seek not salvation, but your wisdom and kindness which knows no bounds. Your experience and leadership may bring peace to this chaotic world. Your partner, Lawrence, has offered to assist you with his wealth of merchant contacts and his old Trade Guild. He will do all he can to support you from the shadows -- a merchant's natural battlefield.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]O Holo, your wisdom and pride are matched only by the magnificence of your tail. With your lover by your side and all of his abilities at hand, will you once again take up the mantle of responsibility for the sake of the ones who so desperately cry out for you in this dark time? Will you be clever enough to stand on the world's stage with -- or against -- other leaders, in order to build the greatest merchant empire the world has ever seen? Will you be able to bring order back to the world so that you may enjoy your days in tranquility? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
Wisewolf of Yoitsu[NEWLINE]Goddess of Harvest[NEWLINE]Holoh the Wheaten Tail
Favorite Quotes:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]You fool![NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Will you be gentle with me?

Holo gains a bonus from various resources:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_FOOD] Food from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Snow[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tundra[ENDCOLOR] tiles.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_FOOD] Food and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_PEACE] Faith from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]unimproved[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Additional bonus[ENDCOLOR] of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_FOOD] Food and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]only[ENDCOLOR] if it is improved with a Farm.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from each [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]improved[ENDCOLOR] source of [ICON_RES_WINE] Wine and [ICON_RES_SHEEP] Sheep [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]only[ENDCOLOR] when worked by a city.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from Holo's unique [ICON_RES_HOLO_APPLES] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchard[ENDCOLOR] improvement [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]only[ENDCOLOR] if built next to fresh water [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]and[ENDCOLOR] worked by a city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Holo's experiences with Lawrence give her deep insight into trade and peddling:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+50% range[ENDCOLOR] for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]land[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Internal[ENDCOLOR] trade routes yield [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25% more[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+5[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]first[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade route established with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]each new[ENDCOLOR] Civilization.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Other[ENDCOLOR] Civilizations gain [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+3[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade route [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]sent to[ENDCOLOR] Holo.[NEWLINE]Merchants are twice as effective, and [ICON_GREAT_MERCHANT_VENICE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Guild Merchants[ENDCOLOR] are earned [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25% faster[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unfortunately, Merchants are hard to trust:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-50%[ENDCOLOR] effectiveness of [ICON_INVEST] Gold gifts to [ICON_CITY_STATE] City-States.[NEWLINE][ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with City-States decay [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]100%[ENDCOLOR] faster.[NEWLINE][ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes with a [ICON_CITY_STATE] City-State provide [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence per turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Of course, Holo is still Holo:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-25%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for the empire, although Settlers are assembled [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25% faster[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE]All specialists consume [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]50% more[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_FOOD] Food.[NEWLINE][ICON_PEACE] Faith costs are [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]doubled[ENDCOLOR], and [ICON_MISSIONARY] Missionaries can only spread a [ICON_RELIGION] Religion [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]once[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Holo's influence has also rubbed off on her followers:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All [ICON_WAR] Military units carry two unique promotions:[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Pride of the Wisewolf[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wisdom of the Wisewolf[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE]Great Generals and Great Admirals carry the promotion [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wisdom of the Great Wisewolf[ENDCOLOR].

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from Snow and Tundra. Bonuses from [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat and improved [ICON_RES_WINE] Wine, [ICON_RES_SHEEP] Sheep and [ICON_RES_HOLO_APPLES] Apples. [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes vastly more effective. Specialists consume more [ICON_FOOD] Food. Penalty to [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
"The life of a merchant isn't easy." - Kraft Lawrence

Guild Merchants are excellent units to supplement rapid income and City-State acquisition. Their faster movement allows them to outrun most enemies, and once at their destination City-State, are able to acquire considerable influence over them. They are best deployed early in the game when a large sum of [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence can provide a dramatic early-game boost to the economy.

Guild merchants are specialized in travel and trade. They are able to travel faster than the Great Merchants they replace, and are much more successful at trade negotiations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Guild Merchants are able to extract [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]twice[ENDCOLOR] as much [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence from conducting [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]trade missions[ENDCOLOR] with [ICON_CITY_STATE] City-States compared to other Great Merchants.

Wolf Pups are groups of younger wolves with little experience, and as such, are the weakest of the group. However, this does not make them any less ferocious, and packs of Wolf Pups can be devastating to any seasoned veteran if caught off-guard. Wolf Pups learn to attack in groups, flanking their enemies from all sides in order to yield the largest amount of damage.

Wolves cost more [ICON_GOLD] Gold in unit maintenance per turn than regular units, so a diverse army is recommended over an army consisting solely of Wolves. Wolf Pups being able to quickly traverse forested and jungle terrain are an excellent early-game scouting and anti-barbarian unit. Wolf Pups work best in large groups to maximize their flanking bonuses. However, Wolves of all types are particularly poor at breaching the hardened defenses of a City's walls, preferring instead to pick off stray enemy units from the battlefield.

Only the Wisewolves are able to train this unit. Wolves are not slowed down in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Forests[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Jungles[ENDCOLOR], but also [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]ignore[ENDCOLOR] Great Generals and suffer a large [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]penalty[ENDCOLOR] when attacking cities. Wolf Pups also receive significant [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]flanking bonuses[ENDCOLOR]. However, they cost more to train, and are more expensive to maintain than the Warriors they replace.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All Wolf units have the unique [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wolf of Yoitsu[ENDCOLOR] promotion, which is kept through upgrades.

Wolf Packs are groups of older, more experienced Wolves, making them extremely dangerous enemies to face, especially in groups. They are strong enough to stand on the front lines, although they are best hidden within forests and jungles, waiting to surprise unsuspecting foes. Wolf Packs are able to support each other when attacking to provide flanking bonuses, and the mere presence of such a group is enough to cause fear and panic in the hearts of nearby enemies.

Wolves cost more [ICON_GOLD] Gold in unit maintenance per turn than regular units, so a diverse army is recommended over an army consisting solely of Wolves. Wolf Packs, being able to quickly traverse forested and jungle terrain, excel at early-game reconnaissance and pressure. Wolf Packs consist largely of older Wolves with more experience at hunting. Their methodic approach to surround their enemies quietly, waiting for the right moment to spring upon their prey, instills a measure of fear and panic into nearby enemies who no doubt know of the ferocity of Wolves. Wolf Packs work well together in groups to maximize their flanking bonuses. However, Wolves of all types are particularly poor at breaching the hardened defenses of a City's walls, preferring instead to pick off stray enemy units from the battlefield.

Only the Wisewolves are able to train this unit. Wolves are not slowed down in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Forests[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Jungles[ENDCOLOR], but also [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]ignore[ENDCOLOR] Great Generals and suffer a large [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]penalty[ENDCOLOR] when attacking cities. Wolf Packs receive a moderate [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]flanking bonus[ENDCOLOR], and cast [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]fear[ENDCOLOR] into nearby enemy units. However, they are unlocked at [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Trapping[ENDCOLOR], cost more to train, and are more expensive to maintain than the Spearmen they replace.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All Wolf units have the unique [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wolf of Yoitsu[ENDCOLOR] promotion, which is kept through upgrades.

The Great Wolves of Yoitsu are the majestic beings some humans have taken to worshipping as akin to a God. They have survived the various hardships throughout the eras, and stand at the pinnacle of the wolf heirarchy. They are strong enough to stand on the front lines, although better used to support nearby allies with their greater mobility and flanking bonus. The fear they instill into nearby enemies can also be taken advantage of.

Wolves cost more [ICON_GOLD] Gold in unit maintenance per turn than regular units, so a diverse army is recommended over an army consisting solely of Wolves. Great Wolves are enormous, allowing them faster movement and the ability to spot enemies farther away, while their knowledge of the forests and jungles allows them to move swiftly through them despite their size. Great Wolves are an excellent, and dramatic, mid-game front-line unit, able to hold their own against most other enemies of its time, and are still great at scouting for exposed flanks. Their great size and strength amplifies the fear felt by nearby enemies, causing them to fall into panic and weaken. However, Wolves of all types are particularly poor at breaching the hardened defenses of a City's walls, preferring instead to pick off stray enemy units from the battlefield.

Only the Wisewolves are able to train this unit. Wolves are not slowed down in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Forests[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Jungles[ENDCOLOR], but also [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]ignore[ENDCOLOR] Great Generals and suffer a large [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]penalty[ENDCOLOR] when attacking cities. Great Wolves receive a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]flanking bonus[ENDCOLOR], and strike a greater amount of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]fear[ENDCOLOR] into nearby enemy units. However, they cost more to train, and are more expensive to maintain than the Pikemen they replace.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All Wolf units have the unique [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wolf of Yoitsu[ENDCOLOR] promotion, which is kept through upgrades.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Great Wolves are very prideful, and despite overwhelming odds will continue to try to fight until the advent of [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Rifling[ENDCOLOR]. Recognizing their era has passed, they will upgrade to [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Riflemen[ENDCOLOR] and will no longer be available.

Must have a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Market[ENDCOLOR] in all cities. Greatly increases trade route income to and from the city in which it is built.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens.[NEWLINE]Collects [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]1[ENDCOLOR] ([COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]2[ENDCOLOR] after [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Economics[ENDCOLOR]) [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trade Guild Branch[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hub[ENDCOLOR], or [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Inn[ENDCOLOR] in the Empire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Provides[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]2[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Trade routes.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+5[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for all [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]originating[ENDCOLOR] from this city.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Incoming[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes to a city with this building generate an additional [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+6[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+3[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route owner.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+2[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after the discovery of [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Railroads[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increases [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connection [ICON_INVEST] Gold income by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]10%[ENDCOLOR] for each city connected to the Capital.[NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of acquiring new tiles by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25%[ENDCOLOR] and reduces enemy [ICON_SPY] Spy effectiveness by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]10%[ENDCOLOR] in all cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grants a free [ICON_GREAT_MERCHANT_VENICE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Guild Merchant[ENDCOLOR] and a free [ICON_SPY] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spy[ENDCOLOR] when first constructed.
"The guild house is like a home for merchants like me." - Kraft Lawrence

The Rowen Trade Guild HQ is an establishment of a head-of-operations for Lawrence's previously-affiliated Trade Guild. The HQ is required before any associated branch buildings can be built, and if lost at any point, must be reconstructed to allow construction of new branch buildings.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Rowen Trade Guild, being a headquarters building, provides a significant increase to the profitability of trade routes entering and exiting the city in which it is built. It also provides substatntial Empire-wide bonuses, and as such, is recommended to build as early as possible for maximum effect. The free [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Guild Merchant[ENDCOLOR] allows a jumpstart of the economy, and an early boost to [ICON_CITY_STATE] City-State [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence. The free [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spy[ENDCOLOR] allows the estblishment of an intelligence network much earlier than normal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Once Guild Branch locations have been established, the HQ receives a share of [ICON_GOLD] Gold from its members, put toward the City's coffers. Building Gold-boosting buildings such as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Banks[ENDCOLOR] will maximize this extra income.

Holo and Lawrence's long sought-after and well-deserved new home. Functions as this empire's [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides extra [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Provides[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Trade route.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increases [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connection [ICON_INVEST] Gold income by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]15%[ENDCOLOR] for each city connected to the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.[NEWLINE]Increases [ICON_GOLD] Gold purchasing costs in the Empire by [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]25%[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+3[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after the discovery of [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Machinery[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lawrence is handling the logistics of the Empire's trade, requiring all trade routes be provided through the Trade Guild.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]No trade routes coming from technologies may be established.[ENDCOLOR]
The Spice and Wolf Inn is built on top of a natural hotspring, both to attract business and contacts, and to allow Holo a place to relax.

The Spice and Wolf Inn provides a good early-game boost to growth, and as the Capital of the Empire, should never be lost.[NEWLINE]Being the Inn where Holo and Lawrence are residing, there exists no place for a Great Work of Art. Instead, Lawrence can apprentice any aspiring merchant placed in the Merchant Specialist slot.

A staple of harvest festivals. Replaces the Shrine.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increases [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age length by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]5%[ENDCOLOR] for each [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wheat Wolf[ENDCOLOR] in the Empire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exceptionally ancient Wheat Wolves built before the advent of [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Theology[ENDCOLOR] become [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wolves of the Harvest[ENDCOLOR] upon its discovery, and all future [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wheat Wolves[ENDCOLOR] gain [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
"I exist in the harvested wheat during this season." - Holo

The Wheat Wolf is a replacement to the Shrine, and is an incredibly useful early-game building. Used to celebrate Harvest Festivals, each Wheat Wolf bestows an increase in Golden Age length, and eventually becomes an important source of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

A staple of harvest festivals.[NEWLINE]These particular idols have survived since the dawn of the Empire, and are renowned for their exceptionally ancient heritage.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Cannot be built, and lost when captured.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Existing [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wheat Wolves[ENDCOLOR] become [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wolves of the Harvest[ENDCOLOR] upon researching [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Theology[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wolf of the Harvest[ENDCOLOR] cannot be sold, and costs [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]3[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn to preserve properly as a relic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increases [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age length by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]5%[ENDCOLOR] for each [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wolf of the Harvest[ENDCOLOR] in the Empire.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after the discovery of [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Archaeology[ENDCOLOR].
"I exist in the harvested wheat during this season." - Holo

Harvest Wolves are only available as an automatic upgrade of the Wheat Wolf, and is unavailable to build normally. This makes them exceedingly rare, and extremely important to defend since once destroyed, will be gone forever. Such ancient relics of the past confer additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and more importantly, [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism, for the Empire.

Requires 1 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron to construct.[NEWLINE]Must have a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Market[ENDCOLOR] in the city, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rowen Trade Guild[ENDCOLOR] built in the Empire. Increases the prosperity of the city in which it is built.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Membership Fee[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Levies a [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]3[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold fee from the city's coffers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adds [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold to every [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Luxury[ENDCOLOR] resource within range of the city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Provides[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Trade route.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+3[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for all [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]originating[ENDCOLOR] from this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold costs of acquiring new tiles by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]15%[ENDCOLOR] and reduces local enemy [ICON_SPY] Spy effectiveness by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]5%[ENDCOLOR] in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_GOLD] Gold purchasing costs in the Empire by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]3%[ENDCOLOR], up to a maximum discount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]30%[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Upgrades to a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trade Guild Hub[ENDCOLOR] upon researching [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Machinery[ENDCOLOR].
"The guild house is like a home for merchants like me." - Kraft Lawrence

The Trade Guild Branch is the first local branch presence available. It provides the logistical capacity for an extra [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade route, and increases the amount of [ICON_GOLD] Gold received from trade, and from nearby luxury resources. Being a more local presence, it is able to embed itself more fully into their City, and provides more localized bonuses. However, the complexity of the additional logistics required to field more trade routes increases the cost of construction of future Trade Guild Branch locations with each new City. It is recommended to build as many Branches as possible before founding new Cities.

Requires 1 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron to construct.[NEWLINE]Must have a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Market[ENDCOLOR] in the city, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rowen Trade Guild[ENDCOLOR] built in the Empire. Replaces the Trade Guild Branch. Greatly increases the prosperity of the city in which it is built.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Membership Fee[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Levies a [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]3[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold fee from the city's coffers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adds [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold to every [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Luxury[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Strategic[ENDCOLOR] resource within range of the city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Provides[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Trade route.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trade routes originating from this city have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25%[ENDCOLOR] increased range.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+4[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for all [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]originating[ENDCOLOR] from this city. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Incoming[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes to a city with this building generate an additional [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+2[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route owner.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold costs of acquiring new tiles by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]20%[ENDCOLOR] and reduces local enemy [ICON_SPY] Spy effectiveness by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]10%[ENDCOLOR] in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_GOLD] Gold purchasing costs in the Empire by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]3%[ENDCOLOR], up to a maximum discount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]30%[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Upgrades to a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trade Guild Inn[ENDCOLOR] upon researching [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Printing Press[ENDCOLOR].
"The guild house is like a home for merchants like me." - Kraft Lawrence

The Trade Guild Hub is an upgrade over the Trade Guild Branch. It provides all of the benefits of the Trade Guild Branch, while including additional benefits with new technology. The Trade Guild Hub bestows [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes established from their City with icnreased range, and its continued influence over the City provides larger local bonuses. In addition, Trade Guild Hubs are now able to process and gain additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold for strategic resources, in addition to luxuries. However, the complexity of the additional logistics required to field more trade routes increases the cost of construction of future Trade Guild Hub locations with each new City. It is recommended to build as many Hubs as possible before founding new Cities.

Requires 1 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron to construct.[NEWLINE]Must have a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Market[ENDCOLOR] in the city, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rowen Trade Guild[ENDCOLOR] built in the Empire. Replaces the Trade Guild Hub. Greatly increases the prosperity of the city in which it is built.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Membership Fee[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Levies a [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]3[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold fee from the city's coffers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adds [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold to every [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Luxury[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Strategic[ENDCOLOR], and [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Bonus[ENDCOLOR] resource within range of the city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Provides[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Trade route.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trade routes originating from this city have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25%[ENDCOLOR] increased range. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+5[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for all [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]originating[ENDCOLOR] from this city. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Incoming[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes to a city with this building generate an additional [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+4[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+2[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route owner.[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after the discovery of [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]Railroads[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold costs of acquiring new tiles by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25%[ENDCOLOR] and reduces local enemy [ICON_SPY] Spy effectiveness by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]15%[ENDCOLOR] in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_GOLD] Gold purchasing costs in the Empire by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]3%[ENDCOLOR], up to a maximum discount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]30%[ENDCOLOR].
"The guild house is like a home for merchants like me." - Kraft Lawrence

The Trade Guild Inn is the final upgrade, and ultimate vision of, the Trade Guild Branch and Hub. It provides all of the benefits of the Trade Guild Hub, while including additional benefits with new technology. The Trade Guild Inn brings in much greater profits from [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade routes coming into and out of the City. Its fully embedded status within the City allows it to provide its maximum local bonuses, and is even able to trade in, and increase the [ICON_GOLD] Gold production of all types of reosurces. As an Inn, it also invites travelers from around the world, increasing [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism for the Empire. However, the complexity of the additional logistics required to field more trade routes increases the cost of construction of future Trade Guild Inn locations with each new City. It is recommended to build as many Inns as possible before founding new Cities.
Units earn combat experience [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25% faster[ENDCOLOR] when involved in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]direct combat[ENDCOLOR].
Great Generals and Admirals increase [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]10% more[ENDCOLOR] than normal.

Units have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+5%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.[NEWLINE]Additional [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+15%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength vs. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Barbarians[ENDCOLOR].
Double movement in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Forest and Jungle[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+25%[ENDCOLOR] bonus to flank attacks.

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Does not benefit from Great Generals.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-50%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength vs. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]cities[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+50%[ENDCOLOR] bonus to flank attacks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lost when upgraded.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Does not benefit from Great Generals.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]-5%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength of nearby [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]enemies[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-50%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength vs. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]cities[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+25%[ENDCOLOR] bonus to flank attacks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lost when upgraded.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Does not benefit from Great Generals.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength of nearby [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]enemies[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-50%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength vs. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]cities[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lost when upgraded.[ENDCOLOR]

Unique improvement available only to The Wisewolves.[NEWLINE]Can be built on any [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]flat[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Grassland[ENDCOLOR] or [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Plains[ENDCOLOR] tile, as long as it has access to [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]fresh water[ENDCOLOR]. Cannot be built adjacent to any other [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchard[ENDCOLOR]. Provides [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness when worked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Happiness[ENDCOLOR] is provided to the Empire [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]only[ENDCOLOR] while the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchard[ENDCOLOR] has access to [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]fresh water[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]and[ENDCOLOR] is worked by a [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchards[ENDCOLOR] within Holo's territory produce [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]1[ENDCOLOR] more [ICON_GOLD] Gold than the improvement normally provides.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]2 or more[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchards[ENDCOLOR] are worked by any City, the City is granted a special [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Luxury Resource[ENDCOLOR] unique to Holo: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Succulent Apples[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This resource is lost if a City is unable to keep at least [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]2[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchards[ENDCOLOR] actively worked with [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens.

Requires [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]flat[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Grassland[ENDCOLOR] or [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Plains[ENDCOLOR] next to [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]fresh water[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for each eligible [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchard[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]only[ENDCOLOR] when worked by a City.[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-1[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD] Gold yield when[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]not[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]controlled by Holo.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grants [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]1[ENDCOLOR] copy of [ICON_RES_HOLO_APPLES] [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Succulent Apples[ENDCOLOR] to the City which works at least [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]2[ENDCOLOR] eligible [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchards[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Grants no yields nor resources if not built near fresh water.[ENDCOLOR]
An [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchard[ENDCOLOR] will provide some [ICON_FOOD] Food along with extra [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness when worked.

"[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Apples are the devil's fruit.[ENDCOLOR]" - Holo, The Wisewolf[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [ICON_GREAT_MUSICIAN][ICON_GREAT_MUSICIAN][ICON_GREAT_MUSICIAN][NEWLINE] Oh, seven apples on a witch's tree[NEWLINE] With seven seeds to plant inside of me[NEWLINE] In springtime I grew a magic song[NEWLINE] Then skipping along, oh I sang the song to everyone[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] I looked at the world through apple eyes[NEWLINE] And cut myself a slice of sunshine pie[NEWLINE] I danced with the peanut butterflies[NEWLINE] Till time went and told me[NEWLINE] To say hello but wave goodbye[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] A thousand sugar stars[NEWLINE] Oh, put them in a jar[NEWLINE] And then whistle 'round the world[NEWLINE] Oh, whistle 'round the world[NEWLINE] I'm a little wolf inside a girl, you say[NEWLINE] And off I'll go from June to May[NEWLINE] Oh, whistling 'round the world[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] I met a golden swan upon the road[NEWLINE] Who was a handsome prince, so I was told[NEWLINE] I asked it the way to yesterday[NEWLINE] Then I was a sailor, and through the day I sailed away[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Bluebird seas I sailed[NEWLINE] With mermaids riding whales[NEWLINE] Oh, whistle 'round the world[NEWLINE] Oh, whistle 'round the world[NEWLINE] I'm a little wolf inside a girl, you say[NEWLINE] And off I'll go down Wonder Way[NEWLINE] Oh, whistling 'round the world[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Through apple eyes[NEWLINE] Oh, there are rose-colored skylines[NEWLINE] Where flying silver spoons[NEWLINE] Eat melting marmalade moons[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Through apple eyes[NEWLINE] I see for millions of miles[NEWLINE] The sun's a diamond shining[NEWLINE] In the nighttime of a summer day[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] A thousand sugar stars[NEWLINE] Oh, put them in a jar[NEWLINE] And then whistle 'round the world[NEWLINE] Oh, whistle 'round the world[NEWLINE] I'm a little wolf inside a girl, you say[NEWLINE] And off I'll go (I can not stay)[NEWLINE] Oh, whistling 'round the world[NEWLINE] Let's whistle 'round the world[NEWLINE] Whistle 'round the world

Unique [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Luxury Resource[ENDCOLOR] which can only be acquired by The Wisewolves.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+4[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, and can be traded with other Civilizations as a normal resource.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Granted to any City which works [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]2 or more[ENDCOLOR] eligible [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchards[ENDCOLOR]. Extra copies may be granted if more than one City meets the requirements. The Empire may receive a maximum of [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]1 copy[ENDCOLOR] of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Succulent Apples[ENDCOLOR] per eligible City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This resource is lost if a City is unable to keep at least [COLOR_RESEARCH_STORED]2[ENDCOLOR] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Apple Orchards[ENDCOLOR] actively worked with [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens.

Set.Text: Allows establishing an additional trade route.[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]The Wisewolves are prohibited from receiving trade routes through technologies.[ENDCOLOR]
